meanings.definition: A sharp, metallic sound made by a clock or similar timepiece.
meanings.sent1: The tock of the clock woke me up in the morning.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the tock of the grandfather clock from the living room.
meanings.sent3: The tock of the clock was so loud, it sounded like a tiny hammer.
meanings.sent4: The tock of the clock echoed through the empty house, a reminder of passing time.
meanings.sent5: The tock of the clock was as clear as a bell, marking each passing second.

meanings.definition: The second part of a tick-tock sound.
meanings.sent1: The tock of the clock followed the tick, creating a rhythmic pattern.
meanings.sent2: I love the tock of the clock as much as the tick that comes before it.
meanings.sent3: The tock of the clock seemed to be in a hurry to catch up with the tick.
meanings.sent4: The tock of the clock was like the echo of the tick, a perfect pair.
meanings.sent5: The tock of the clock completed the tick, making a harmonious duo.

meanings.sent1: I could hear the clock tocking softly in the background.
meanings.sent2: The old clock tocks every hour, reminding us of its presence.
meanings.sent3: The clock tocks so loudly, it's like it's trying to talk to us.
meanings.sent4: Time seems to tock away faster when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The clock tocks with a steady rhythm, never faltering in its duty.
